basics.name: Benjamín Alberto Jorquera Jorquera
basics.label: Computer and Informatics Engineer
basics.summary: Computer and Informatics Engineer with three years of software development experience, skilled in data science, algorithms, and agile teamwork, active in communities like GitHub and StackOverflow, and known for being proactive, adaptable, and solution-oriented.

work.name: Principal Cuprum AFP
work.summary: At Cuprum AFP, I work as an Associate Engineer in digital experience services. Initially part of the Customer Support team, I developed digital products for the private website with JavaScript, C# Vue, and .NET. Following a restructuring, I joined the Advice team, where I now work with AWS, GitHub, and TypeScript, continuously expanding my skills.

work.name: Centry
work.summary: At Centry, I started as an intern developing a product importer for Mercado Libre. Then, as a Junior Software Developer, I worked in Full Stack development and documentation. I collaborated in the creation of a synchronization error viewer using technologies such as Python, Ruby on Rails, and MongoDB, and integrated services such as BSale.

publications.name: Particle Swarm Optimization of Hyperparameters for Support Vector Machine Regression Models in the Analysis of Cerebral Autoregulation
publications.summary: Cerebral blood autoregulation is the brain's ability to maintain adequate flow despite changes in blood pressure. There is no standardized protocol for assessing it, leading to various modeling approaches. This study explores using particle swarm optimization (PSO) to improve model selection, comparing it with traditional methods. It focused on FIR and ARX models, both linear and nonlinear. PSO performed well, especially with ARX models, improving search time and yielding results similar to exhaustive searches.

references.name: Sebastian Rozas (+569 76180286)
references.reference: Seba is Product Owner (or Product Manager) of Cuprum Advice team, I have been working with him for more than a year, we have developed a great variety of projects together.

projects.name: Interpino App
projects.summary: InterPino is a local desktop application designed for the Patient Management Unit at El Pino Hospital. It automates the process of sending interconsultations from service emails to specialty emails stored in a database, considering factors such as patient service origin, age, and attention status (open or closed).
